com.receiver2d.engine

Class Geometry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.receiver2d.engine.Geometry

  • public class Geometry
extends java.lang.Object
    Deals with analyzing collisions between geometric figures in two-dimensional space. This comes in handy for all sorts of things pertaining to the game engine, such as AI and physics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Geometry()

      static Vector2D linearIntersectionPoint(Vector2D[] ln1, Vector2D[] ln2)
      Checks whether or not two finite lines (Vector2f array of length 2) collide, and if they do, returns the point of their collision as a Vector2f.

    • Method Detail

      • linearIntersectionPoint

        public static Vector2D linearIntersectionPoint(Vector2D[] ln1,
                               Vector2D[] ln2)
        Checks whether or not two finite lines (Vector2f array of length 2) collide, and if they do, returns the point of their collision as a Vector2f.
        Parameters:
        ln1 - An array containing two points on the first line.
        ln2 - An array containing two points on the second line.
        Returns:
        A point of intersection, or null otherwise.

      • polygonalIntersectionPoints

        public static Vector2D[] polygonalIntersectionPoints(Vector2D[] polyA,
                                     Vector2D[] polyB)
        Checks whether two polygons collide. Polygons are defined as an array of vertices with each vertex (Vector2f) connected to the next one in the array. Example: square - (0,0) (0,1) (1,1) (1,0)
        Parameters:
        polyA - the array of points for the first polygon
        polyB - the array of points for the second polygon
        Returns:
        The array of points where the two polygons overlap, or null if they do not collide at all.

      • checkCollides

        public static boolean checkCollides(Vector2D[] poly1,
                    Vector2D[] poly2)
        Returns a true/false value determining whether or not two polygons or lines collide.
        Parameters:
        poly1 - A Vector2f array containing points of the first polygon/line.
        poly2 - A Vector2f array containing points of the second polygon/line.
        Returns:
        "true" if the polygons collide; "false" otherwise

      • pointInPolygon

        public static boolean pointInPolygon(Vector2D pnt,
                     Vector2D[] poly)
        Determines if a point is inside a polygon using a winding algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pnt - A point.
        poly - An array of points, or a polygon.
        Returns:
        A true/false value depending on whether or not the point is inside the polygon.

      • atan

        public static float atan(float x,
         float y)

      • circleCollision

        public static Vector2D circleCollision()
